description: When running a DELETE operation using the API v1/{tenant_id}/volumes/{volume_id}, a 202 return code is used to indicate success, though no response body/data is included.  Technically, this is not at odds with the RFC since it says that a 202 SHOULD include data, but it is not required to.  However, a 204 return code would seem a better fit in this scenario.
title: Successful volume delete should return 204

comments.content: When running a DELETE operation using the API v1/{tenant_id}/volumes/{volume_id}, a 202 return code is used to indicate success, though no response body/data is included. comments.content: Can't change for V2 API but can for the V3 API
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cyeoh-0

comments.content:
I'm not sure I agree with this, the 202 technically indicates the request was received successfully and is being processed.

The 204 indicates that it was completed and that there's "no return data", in reality the return of the API calls do NOT indicate successful completion, just that the process was successfully started.  To me it seems that 202 is actually appropriate.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~john-griffith

comments.content:
+1 John

"The server has fulfilled the request but does not need to return an entity-body, and might want to return updated metainformation."

http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec10.html
